question: The Vansda National Park (VNP) is located in which state?
explanation: The Vansda National Park (VNP) is a protected area which represents the thick woodlands of the Dangs and southern Gujarat, and is situated in the Navsari District of Gujarat.  It is home to an array of wild animals viz. Indian leopard, rhesus macaque, common palm civet, Hanuman langur, small Indian civet, four-horned antelope, wild boar, Indian porcupine, barking deer, etc.  The best time to visit is post-monsoon season till winter when the forests are lush green and streams are full.
